National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60Â° or more to the horizontal that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60Ã‚Â° or more to the horizontal and that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.

National Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17. and 3.2.5.18.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.18. and 3.2.5.19.

National Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to part 3.. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3.

National Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with part 3. (See also Sentence 9.9.4.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with Subsection 3.2.8.

National Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are entirely contained within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(2) and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(1) shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence (1) shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.10.4.(2) and 9.10.10.4.(3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

National Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in part 9. and serving no other appliance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in Section 9.21. and serving no other appliance.

National Sentence Text:
The wall described in Sentence (1) shall provide continuous protection from
the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence (1) shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.

National Sentence Text:
Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence (1) and the roof
deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence (1) and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is,(a) less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and (b) less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence (2) shall be provided by a) noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, b) not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to CSA A82.31-M, “Gypsum Board Application,” c) not less than 11 mm thick plywood, d) not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or e) not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.12.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence (2) shall be provided by,(a) noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650Ã‚Â°C, (b) not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum wallboard installed according to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application," (c) not less than 11 mm thick plywood, (d) not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or (e) not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4.(2) do not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence (1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space, and completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply.

National Sentence Text:
Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or
below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence (2) do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence (2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.13.13.(2) to 9.10.13.13.(5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with ArticlesÃ‚ 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.9.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760Â°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2 , and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct,(a) has a melting point not below 760Ã‚Â°C, (b) has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cmÃ‚Â², and (c) supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760Â°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the air flow is upward provided,(a) the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760Ã‚Â°C, (b) the branch duct is carried up inside the riser at least 500 mm, and (c) the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.

National Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760Â°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided,(a) the ducts have a melting point above 760Ã‚Â°C, and (b) each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall a) conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, “Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies,” and b) activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes required in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall(a) conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, "Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies", and (b) activate at a temperature approximately 30Ã‚Â°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text:
A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum
fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, “Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies.” (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, "Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies". (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence 9.10.13.2.(1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence (1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

National Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of at least 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

National Article Title: Doors as a Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to part 9. in addition to this Subsection.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.4. Doors as a Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. which has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence 9.10.13.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence (2).

National Sentence Text:
Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames
having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a minimum metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.

National Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5.(1) shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2 .
P/T Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence (1) shall not exceed 0.8 mÃ‚Â² in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 mÃ‚Â².

National Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S105-16 Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104
P/T Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S105, "Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104".

National Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2 , with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 mÃ‚Â², with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, if a fire compartment on either side of the fire separation is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2 , with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 mÃ‚Â², with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which Subsection 9.10.15.applies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.10.15., this Subsection applies to all buildings.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be,(a) taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and (b) calculated as, (i) the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or (ii) the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) where the unprotected openings are glazed with, (a) wired glass in steel frames as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or (b) glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence (1) where, (a) all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and (b) the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence (1) where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence 9.10.14.5.(1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text:
Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of
Sentence (1), provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
P/T Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating, where the building is 1 storey in building height, is of noncombustible construction, is classified as a low-hazard industrial occupancy and used only for low fire load occupancies, such as power-generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating where, (a) the building is 1 storey in building height, (b) the building is of noncombustible construction, (c) the building is classified as low hazard industrial occupancy and is used only for low fire load occupancies such as power generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and (d) the exposing building face has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each stair where the stair passes through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into,(a) compartments having no dimension greater than 60 m, if such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating of 25 or less, and (b) compartments of not more than 300 mÃ‚Â² in area, if such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text:
No dimension of the concealed space described in Clause (5)(b) shall exceed
20 m.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: No dimension of the compartment described in Clause (4)(b) shall exceed 20 m.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.16.2.(2), fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level, at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.2. Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring,(a) at each floor level, (b) at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and (c) at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.

National Sentence Text:
Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), fire blocks shall be constructed
of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, “Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials.”
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text:
Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence (1) if they are constructed of
not less than a) 0.38 mm sheet steel, b) 12.7 mm gypsum board, c) 12.5 mm  plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, d) 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or e) 38 mm lumber.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence (1), if they are constructed of not less than,(a) 0.38 mm sheet steel, (b) 12.7 mm gypsum wallboard, (c) 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, (d) 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or (e) 38 mm lumber.

National Sentence Text:
In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board a) has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, b) is securely fastened to one set of studs,
c) extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above
the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and d) completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates.
(See Note A-3.1.11.7.(7).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag, is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space is not more than 25 mm and the insulation board,(a) has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, (b) is securely fastened to one set of studs, (c) extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and (d) completely fills the nominal gap of 25 mm between the headers and between the wall plates.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.17.1.(3), doors need not conform to Sentence 9.10.17.1.(1) provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), doors need not conform to Sentence (1) provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.

National Sentence Text:
Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to
Sentences (1) and (2).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors within dwelling units, other than vehicle garage doors, need not conform to Sentences (1) and (2).

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies
and ceiling assemblies a) by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4. to 9.29.9., b) provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet
metal that i) is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, ii) is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and iii) has a melting point not less than 650°C, or c) by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.15.(2). (See Note A-3.1.4.2.(1)(c).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (4), foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies, by any of the following:(a) one of the finishes described in Subsections 9.29.4. to 9.29.9., (b) provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, sheet metal that, (i) is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, (ii) is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and (iii) has a melting point not less than 650Ã‚Â°C, or (c) any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.12A.(2).

National Article Title: Ceilings in Exits or Public Corridors
National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.17.2. Ceilings in Exits or Public Corridors
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (2), at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of
every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in Article 9.9.8.5. shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See Article 9.10.17.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: At least 90% of the total wall surface in any unsprinklered public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

National Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 m2 in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 mÃ‚Â² in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Article Title: Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (2), where a vertical fire separation having a
fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems may be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.18.6. Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 1 h separates a portion of a building from the remainder of the building and there are no openings through the fire separation other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and conduit, the requirements for fire alarm and detection systems is permitted to be applied to each portion so separated as if it were a separate building.

National Sentence Text: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: A central vacuum cleaning system serving more than one suite or storey in a building equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall a) meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals (see Note A-3.2.4.18.(2)), or b) be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.
P/T Sentence Text: The sound patterns of smoke alarms shall,(a) meet the temporal patterns of alarm signals, or (See A-3.2.4.20.(2) in Appendix A.) (b) be a combination of temporal pattern and voice relay.

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Article 9.10.19.1. and Sentence (1) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.19.3. Location of Smoke Alarms (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke alarms required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text:
Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors a) are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual
suites, b) except as permitted in Sentence (4), are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, “Installation of Fire Alarm Systems,” and c) form part of the fire alarm system. (See Note A-3.2.4.20.(8).)
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors, (a) are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, (b) except as provided by Sentence (4), are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", and (c) form part of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as stated in Sentence (3) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors permitted to be installed in lieu of smoke alarms as provided in Sentence (3) are permitted to sound localized alarms within individual suites, and need not sound an alarm throughout the rest of the building.

National Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systems which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence 9.10.19.6.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Suites of residential occupancy equipped with smoke detectors installed to CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", which are part of the fire alarm system in lieu of smoke alarms as permitted in Sentence 9.10.19.4.(3), need not incorporate the manually operated device required in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S540, “Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance,” are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1. and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system a) is capable of sounding audible signals as stated in Articles 9.10.19.2. and 9.10.19.5., b) is powered as stated in Article 9.10.19.4., and c) is equipped with a silencing device as stated in Article 9.10.19.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a fire alarm system is installed or required in a building, smoke detectors forming part of a residential fire warning system installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S540 "Residential Fire and Life Safety Warning Systems: Installation, Inspection, Testing and Maintenance", are permitted to be installed in lieu of all smoke alarms required by Articles 9.10.19.1. and 9.10.19.3., provided that the fire warning system,(a) is capable of sounding audible signals in accordance with Articles 9.10.19.2. and 9.10.19.5., (b) is powered in accordance with Article 9.10.19.4., and (c) is equipped with a silencing device conforming to Article 9.10.19.6.

National Article Title: Major Occupancies above Other Major Occupancies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.2.3. Major Occupancies Above Other Major Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than 1 major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

National Article Title: Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy
National Sentence Text: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1. and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies .
P/T Article Title: 9.10.2.4. Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy
P/T Sentence Text: In a building containing more than 1 major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.2.3. and 9.10.8.1. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(3), a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1?100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a window or access panel providing an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide and having a sill height of not more than 900 mm above the floor shall be provided on the second and third storeys of every building in at least one wall facing on a street if such storeys are not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1.(1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence (1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.

National Sentence Text:
Access required in Sentence (1) may be provided by a door, window or other
means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be provided by a door, window or other means that provides an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, the sill height of which shall not be more than 900 mm above the floor.

National Sentence Text:
Access required in Sentence (1) may also be provided by an interior stair
accessible from the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence (1) is also permitted to be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Notes A-9.10.20.3.(1) and A-3.2.5.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3.(1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence (1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.

National Sentence Text:
Except in dwelling units and except as provided in Sentence (2), the surface
flame-spread rating of wall and ceiling surfaces in corridors and walkways, exclusive of doors, shall not exceed 25 over not less than 90% of the exposed surface area and not more than 150 over the remaining surface area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in dwelling units and except as provided in Sentence (2), the surface flame-spread rating of wall and ceiling surfaces in corridors and walkways, exclusive of doors, shall not exceed 25 over not less than 90 percent of the exposed surface area and not more than 150 over the remaining surface area.

National Sentence Text: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.

National Sentence Text: Hose stations required in Sentence 9.10.21.9.(1) shall be located near an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Hose stations required in Sentence (1) shall be located near an exit.

National Sentence Text:
Hoses referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and
shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of not less than 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of not less than 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Hoses referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of at least 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of at least 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.22.2.(2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.

National Sentence Text:
The vertical clearance described in Sentence (1) for framing, finishes and
cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop may be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners, provided the framing, finishes and cabinets a) are noncombustible, or b) are protected by a metal hood that projects 125 mm beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.
P/T Sentence Text: The vertical clearance described in Sentence (1) for framing, finishes and cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop is permitted to be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners provided the framing, finishes and cabinets,(a) are noncombustible, or (b) are are protected by a metal hood with a 125 mm projection beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), combustible wall framing, finishes or cabinets within 450 mm of the area where the cooktop is to be located shall be protected above the level of the heating elements or burners by material providing fire resistance at least equivalent to that provided by a 9.5 mm thickness of gypsum board.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), combustible wall framing, finishes or cabinets within 450 mm of the area where the cooktop is to be located shall be protected above the level of the heating elements or burners by material providing fire resistance not less than that of a 9.5 mm thickness of gypsum board.

National Sentence Text: Counter-top splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).
P/T Sentence Text: Countertop splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence 9.10.22.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to in this Part as a "surface flame-spread rating", it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles which contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles that contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.

National Sentence Text: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooftop enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.5.1.(2) and 9.10.5.1.(4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence (2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 3.1.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.

National Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8.(2) and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1 800 mm in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

National Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence (1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence (1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling is permitted to be reduced to 30 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence (2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if a) the floor area is sprinklered, b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if a) the floor area is sprinklered, b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and d) the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4), and (d) the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.16.(2) and 9.10.9.16.(3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(5), where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy,(a) an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and (b) every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17.(2) and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence (1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where, (a) the building is not more than one storey in building height, (b) the building is operated as a single suite, and (c) the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective air barrier to gas and exhaust fumes.

National Article Title: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
National Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.18.(1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.18. Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
P/T Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence (1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5., 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.3. Openings to be Protected With Closures
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. to 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.4.(2) to 9.10.9.4.(4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

National Sentence Text:
Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming
part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the fire damper is a) installed in conformance with NFPA 80, “Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives,” or b) specifically designed with a fire stop.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the fire damper is, (a) installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives," or (b) designed specifically with a fire stop.

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts,

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3).
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or other similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3).

National Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketting that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketing that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways which are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), where the concrete provides not less than 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways that are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), where the concrete provides at least 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.

National Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2 .

National Sentence Text: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2 , or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.

National Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete block shall conform to CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units", and shall have a compressive strength over the average net cross-sectional area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

National Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.

National Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced, mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry and placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced,(a) mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", (b) grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", and (c) placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of piers described in Sentence (2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.

National Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence 9.15.2.3.(2), they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Where concrete block is used for piers described in Sentence (2), they shall be laid with cores placed vertically, and where the width of the building is 4.3 m or less, placed with their longest dimension at right angles to the longest dimension of the building.

National Sentence Text: Foundations of wood-frame  construction shall conform to a) CSA S406, “Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings,” or b) Part 4. (See Note A-9.15.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Foundations of wood frame construction shall conform to,(a) CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings", or (b) Part 4. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings may be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings shall be provided under walls, pilasters, columns, piers, fireplaces and chimneys that bear on soil or rock, except that footings are permitted to be omitted under piers or monolithic concrete walls if the safe loadbearing capacity of the soil or rock is not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

National Article Title: Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), the minimum footing width or area requirements provided in Articles 9.15.3.4. to 9.15.3.7. shall apply to footings, where the footings support foundation walls of masonry, concrete, or flat insulating concrete form walls, above-ground walls of masonry, flat insulating concrete form walls or light wood-frame construction, and floors and roofs of light wood-frame construction, the span of supported joists does not exceed 4.9 m, and the specified live load on any floor supported by the footing does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.).
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.3. Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), the minimum footing width or area requirements provided in ArticlesÃ‚ 9.15.3.4. to 9.15.3.7. shall apply to footings where,(a) the footings support, (i) foundation walls of masonry, concrete, or flat insulating concrete form walls, (ii) above ground walls of masonry, flat insulating concrete form walls or light wood frame construction, and (iii) floors and roofs of light wood frame construction, (b) the span of supported joists does not exceed 4.9 m, and (c) the specified live load on any floor supported by the footing does not exceed 2.4 kPa.

National Article Title: Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), where the span of the supported joists exceeds 4.9 m, footings shall be designed in accordance with part 4.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.3. Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.15.3.4.(2), where the span of the supported joists exceeds 4.9 m, footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.

National Article Title: Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
National Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with part 4.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.3. Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
P/T Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.15.3.4.(2) and 9.15.3.4.(3) and in Articles 9.15.3.5. to 9.15.3.7., the minimum footing width or area shall comply with Table 9.15.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and in Articles 9.15.3.5. to 9.15.3.7., the minimum footing width or area shall comply with Table 9.15.3.4.
