National Article Title: Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
National Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws spaced at the appropriate spacing described in part 9., and penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.
P/T Article Title: 9.24.1.5. Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws,(a) spaced at the appropriate spacing described in Section 9.29., and (b) penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.

National Sentence Text: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.
P/T Sentence Text: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness of not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.

National Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1 200 mm in width, a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and b) the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and (b) the steel thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence (1) exceed 1 200 mm in width, a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and b) the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence (1) exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and (b) the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence 9.24.2.4.(3) and the top runner exceeds 400 mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence (3) and the top runner exceeds 400Ã‚ mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence 9.24.3.1.(2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence (2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.

National Sentence Text: Studs at openings and which are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs at openings and that are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence 9.24.3.2.(1) shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence (1) shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.

National Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of 2 runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Note A-9.24.3.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of two runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence 9.24.3.5.(1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.

National Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence 9.24.3.6.(1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.
P/T Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence (1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.

National Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7.(1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.
P/T Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence (1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.

National Sentence Text: The openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7.(1) shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.
P/T Sentence Text: The openings described in Sentence (1) shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board at least 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.

National Sentence Text: This Section is concerned with heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.25.2.2.(2), thermal insulation shall conform to the requirements of ASTM C 726-12 Mineral Wool Roof Insulation Board CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.25-M87 Thermal Insulation, Phenolic, Faced CGSB 51-GP-27M-1979 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Loose Fill ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards ULC CAN/ULC-S702-14 Mineral Fibre Thermal Insulation for Buildings ULC CAN/ULC-S703-09 Cellulose Fibre Insulation for Buildings ULC CAN/ULC-S704-11 Thermal Insulation, Polyurethane and Polyisocyanurate, Boards, Faced ULC CAN/ULC-S705.1-15 Thermal Insulation â€“ Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density â€“ Material Specification or ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), thermal insulation shall conform to the requirements of,(a) ASTM C726, "Mineral Wool Roof Insulation Board," (b) CAN/CGSB-51.25-M, "Thermal Insulation, Phenolic, Faced", (c) CGSB 51-GP-27M, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Loose Fill", (d) CAN/ULC-S701.1, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards", (e) CAN/ULC-S702 "Mineral Fibre Thermal Insulation for Buildings", (f) CAN/ULC-S703, "Cellulose Fibre Insulation for Buildings", (g) CAN/ULC-S704, "Thermal Insulation, Polyurethane and Polyisocyanurate, Boards, Faced", (h) CAN/ULC-S705.1, "Thermal Insulation - Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density - Material - Specification", or (i) CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread ratings requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence 9.25.2.2.(1) shall not apply. (See Note A-9.25.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence (1) shall not apply. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and shall be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.

National Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Note A-9.25.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor, if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than a 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than,(a) reserved, (b) 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or (c) 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.2.4.(2) to 9.25.2.4.(6), loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (6), loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.

National Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and 2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than,(a) 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and (b) 2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.

National Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used in wood-frame walls of existing buildings. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation may be used in wood frame walls of existing buildings. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood-frame walls of new buildings, the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement, the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to the installation of the interior finish, the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood frame walls of new buildings, (a) the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement, (b) the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to installation of the interior finish, (c) the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and (d) no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.

National Sentence Text: Water repellent loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used between the outer and inner wythes of masonry cavity walls. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Water repellent loose-fill insulation may be used between the outer and inner wythes of masonry cavity walls. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and to minimize airflow into the insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material. (See Article 9.19.1.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken, (a) to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and (b) to minimize air flow into the loose-fill insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material.

National Sentence Text: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation â€“ Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density â€“ Application
P/T Sentence Text: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with CAN/ULC-S705.2, "Thermal Insulation Ã¢â‚¬" Spray-Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density Ã¢â‚¬" Application".

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is installedused to serveprovide asairtightness in the vapourair barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene is installed to serve as the vapour barrier, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide the air-tightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to minimize air leakage.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows and other fenestration shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where access hatches and sump pit covers are installed through assemblies constructed with an air barrier system, they shall be weatherstripped around their perimeters to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: An access hatch installed through an assembly constructed with an air barrier system shall be weatherstripped around the perimeter to minimize air leakage.

National Sentence Text: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(PaÂ·sÂ·m2) measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup).
P/T Sentence Text: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(PaÃ¢Ë†â„¢sÃ¢Ë†â„¢m2), measured in accordance with ASTMÃ‚ E96Ã‚ /Ã‚ E96M, "Water Vapor Transmission of Materials", using the desiccant method (dry cup).

National Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.33-M89 Vapour Barrier Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.33-M, "Vapour Barrier, Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction".

National Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
P/T Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CAN/CGSB-1.501-M, "Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard".

National Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Note A-9.25.4.3.(2) and Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix A and Appendix Note A-9.25.5.1.(1))

National Sentence Text: Where the same product is used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the product shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the assembly to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Notes A-9.25.4.3.(2), Note A-9.25.5.1.(1) and Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the same product is used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the product shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the assembly to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix Notes A9.25.4.3.(2), A-9.25.5.1.(1) and A-9.25.5.2.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.5.1.(2) to 9.25.5.1.(4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to Article 9.25.5.2., where the material has an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(sÂ·m2) at 75 Pa, and a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(PaÂ·sÂ·m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup) (see Note A-9.25.5.1.(1)(a)(ii)), and the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to ArticleÃ‚ 9.25.5.2. where,(a) the material has, (i) an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(sÃ¢Ë†â„¢m2) at 75 Pa, and (ii) a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(PaÃ¢Ë†â„¢sÃ¢Ë†â„¢m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E96Ã‚ /Ã‚ E96M, "Water Vapor Transmission of Materials", using the desiccant method (dry cup), and (See Appendix A.) (b) the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.17.2. need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.16.2. need not comply with Sentence (1). (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where a material has a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(Pa?s?m2) and a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2Â·K)/W and the heating degree-days of the building location are less than 6000, the assembly need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials need not comply with Sentence (1) where,(a) the material has, (i) a water vapour permeance not less than 30 ng/(PaÃ¢Ë†â„¢sÃ¢Ë†â„¢m2), and (ii) a thermal resistance not less than 0.7 (m2Ã¢Ë†â„¢K)/W, and (b) the heating degree-days of the building location, in degrees Celsius, are less than 6 000.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roof" shall mean sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them, including platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation. (See Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In this Section,(a) "roof" means sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them and includes platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation, and (b) "roofing" means the primary covering for roofs. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to effectively shed water, prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to,(a) effectively shed water, (b) prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and (c) minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 9.26.1.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to the remainder of this Section, or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to, (a) this Section, or (b) Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Methods described in CSA CAN3-A123.51-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper or in CSA CAN3-A123.52-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less Than 1:3 are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Methods described in CAN3-A123.51-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper", or CAN3-A123.52-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less than 1:3", are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.

National Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlaid between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.
P/T Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence (1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlayed between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.

National Sentence Text: Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(2) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Interlayed strips in Sentence (2) shall be lapped at least 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.
P/T Sentence Text: No fewer than two plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.

National Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(1) need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence (1) may be omitted where a gravel stop is provided at the edge of roofs.

National Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) is fastened and 2 plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) is fastened and two plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.

National Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.
P/T Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.

National Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be at least No. 15 felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be not less than No.15 felt.

National Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of not less than 3 mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of at least three mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.

National Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.7.(1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence (1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with not less than a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with at least a 50 mm headlap and a 50Ã‚ mm sidelap between each sheet.

National Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence (1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.

National Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a watertight joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a water-tight joint.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than,(a) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (b) 0.46 mm thick copper, (c) 0.46 mm thick zinc, or (d) 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.51-M90 Application for Hot-Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing
P/T Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CAN/CGSB-37.51-M, "Application for Hot Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing".

National Sentence Text: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M-1979 Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing Membrane
P/T Sentence Text: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M, "Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing Membrane".

National Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner which will prevent soil erosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner that will prevent soil erosion.

National Sentence Text: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-A and 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturerâ€™s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.A. and 9.26.2.1.B. shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s instructions.

National Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1.(2) and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: See Sentence 9.26.3.1.(2).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1.(2) and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: See Sentence 9.26.3.1.(3).

National Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.

National Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerâ€™s written recommendations.
P/T Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s written recommendations.

National Sentence Text:
Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or
supporting constructions due to water ingress, roofs and constructions that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from a) exterior walls, and b) guards that are connected to the roof, or to a construction that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts. (See Notes A-9.26.1.1.(1), A-9.26.4.1. and A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements due to water ingress, roofs and elements that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from,(a) exterior walls, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof, or to an element that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text:
The slope required by Sentence (4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive
slope a) after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and exterior columns (see Note A-9.27.3.8.(4)), and b) once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope required in Sentence (4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope,(a) after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and on exterior columns, and (b) once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls.

National Sentence Text:
Except where the omission of flashing will not adversely affect adjacent
supported or supporting constructions, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and a) walls that rise above the roof, and b) guards that are connected to the roof by more than pickets or posts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the omission will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and,(a) walls that rise above the roof, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof by other than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.33 mm thick copper, 0.35 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.33 mm thick copper, (d) 0.35 mm thick zinc, or (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least a) one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or b) 2 layers of roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with, (a) at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or (b) no fewer than two layers of roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.5.1.(2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection is not required over unheated garages, carports and porches, where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with part 9., on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or in regions with 3?500 or fewer degree-days.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection is not required,(a) over unheated garages, carports and porches, (b) where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, (c) on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., (d) on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or (e) in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be a) asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/m2, or b) No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt.

National Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than two thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), shingles shall be fastened with at least four nails or staples for 1 000 mm wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.

National Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least 6 staples.
P/T Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least six staples.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.7.6.(1) shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.

National Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.

National Sentence Text: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.

P/T Sentence Text: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M, "Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use".

P/T Sentence Text: Vinyl siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-41.24, "Rigid Vinyl Siding, Soffits and Fascia".

P/T Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in Subsection 9.27.5. for metal siding.

P/T Sentence Text: The materials used in exterior insulation finish systems shall conform to CAN/ULC-S716.1, "Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) Ã¢â‚¬" Materials and Systems".

National Article Title: Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
National Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that precipitation ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to a) minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and b) prevent the ingress of precipitation into interior space. (See Note A-9.27.2.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.1. Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
P/T Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to,(a) minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and (b) prevent ingress into interior space. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against ingress of precipitation with an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection where the wall encloses spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: First and Second Planes of Protection
National Sentence Text:
Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise
cladding assemblies with first and second planes of protection,
a) the first plane of protection shall
i) consist of cladding with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and ii) be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and
managing precipitation ingress caused by the kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences (see Subsection 9.27.4.), b) the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to (see Subsection 9.27.3.) i) intercept all rain and snow that gets past the first plane of
protection, and ii) effectively dissipate any rain or snow to the exterior, and
c) the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained i) at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and
ii) at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.3. First and Second Planes of Protection
P/T Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise assemblies with first and second planes of protection,(a) the first plane of protection shall, (i) consist of cladding, with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and (ii) be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences, (b) the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to, (i) intercept all precipitation that gets past the first plane of protection, and (ii) effectively dissipate any precipitation to the exterior, and (c) the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at, (i) wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (ii) the interface with other wall assemblies.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane having an appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane with appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: Except for cladding systems conforming to Subsection 9.27.13., the inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.

P/T Sentence Text: The inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with,(a) Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6., or (b) Subsection 9.27.13.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: Flashing material and its installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.
