P/T Sentence Text: Flashing material and installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type".

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.

National Article Title: Insulating Sheathing in lieu of Sheathing Membrane
National Sentence Text:
Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence (1), a) sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all
joints, and b) the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be i) sealed at all joints, or ii) lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure
drainage of water to the exterior.
(See Note A-9.27.3.4.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.4. Insulating Sheathing in Lieu of Sheathing Membrane
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence (1),(a) sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and (b) the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be, (i) sealed at all joints, or (ii) lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least 2 layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Article 9.23.17.1. and Note A-9.27.3.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least two layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing membrane.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing paper.

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1), and its thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.17.2.-A.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1), and the thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.16.2.A.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentences 9.27.3.6.(2) or 9.27.3.6.(3), as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentence (2) or (3), as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1), provided the cladding is applied so that all edges are directly supported by framing, the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and covered with battens, shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence (1), provided the cladding is applied so that,(a) all edges are directly supported by framing, (b) the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and, (i) covered with battens, (ii) shiplapped, or (iii) otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and (c) the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and, (i) shiplapped, or (ii) otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.

National Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence (1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or 1.02 mm thick vinyl.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.46 mm thick copper, (d) 0.46 mm thick zinc, (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or (f) 1.02 mm thick vinyl.

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at a) every horizontal junction between cladding elements, b) every horizontal offset in the cladding, and c) every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where i) the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be
concentrated along that line, or
ii) the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the
cladding above. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at,(a) every horizontal junction between claddings elements, (b) every horizontal offset in the cladding, and (c) every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where, (i) the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or (ii) the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text:
Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1) a) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, b) where i) the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)),
and ii) the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the
ingress of precipitation into the air space, or c) at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where i) the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and ii) the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented
air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)).
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1),(a) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, (b) where, (i) the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space, and (ii) the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize ingress of precipitation into the air space, or (c) at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where, (i) the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and (ii) the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences (1) and (3) shall a) extend not less than 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane (see Article 9.27.3.4.), b) have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, c) terminate at each end with an end-dam i) with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 the value of the 1-in-5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and ii) at the height defined in Subclause (c)(i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, d) lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and e) terminate in a drip offset not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. (See Note  A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences (1) and (3) shall, (a) extend not less that 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane, (b) have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, (c) terminate at each end with an end-dam, (i) with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 of the value of the 1 in 5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and (ii) at the height defined in Subclause (i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, (d) lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and (e) terminate in a drip extending not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2. , 9.20.13.12. and 9.28.1.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain.

National Sentence Text:
Sealants shall be a) a non-hardening type suitable for exterior use, b) selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and c) compatible with and adhere to the substrate to which they are applied.
(See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be,(a) non-hardening types suitable for exterior use, (b) selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and (c) compatible with, and adhere to, the substrate to which they are applied. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to ASTM C 834-10 Latex Sealants ASTM C 920-14 Elastomeric Joint Sealants ASTM C 1184-13 Structural Silicone Sealants or ASTM C 1311-10 Solvent Release Sealants
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to,(a) ASTM C834, "Latex Sealants", (b) ASTM C920, "Elastomeric Joint Sealants", (c) ASTM C1184, "Structural Silicone Sealants", or (d) ASTM C1311, "Solvent Release Sealants".

National Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330, “Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants.” (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C1330, "Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants".

National Sentence Text:
Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), cladding shall be fastened to the
framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2), (3) and (4), cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.

National Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 12.5 mm plywood, or 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 12.5 mm plywood, or (c) 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 7.5 mm plywood, or 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 7.5 mm plywood, or (c) 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing that is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes may be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence 9.27.5.7.(1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence (1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.

National Sentence Text:
Bevel siding shall be a) not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and b) not less than
i) 12 mm thick at the butt for siding 184 mm or less in width, and ii) 14.3 mm thick at the butt for siding wider than 184 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be,(a) not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and (b) not less than, (i) 12 mm thick at the butt for sidings 184 mm or less in width, and (ii) 14.3 mm thick at the butt for sidings wider than 184 mm.

National Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than 9.5 mm for matched siding, 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or 12 mm for vertical battens.
P/T Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than,(a) 9.5 mm for matched siding, (b) 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or (c) 12 mm for vertical battens.

National Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles or CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to,(a) CSA O118.1, "Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles", or (b) CSA O118.2-M, "Eastern White Cedar Shingles".

National Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm so that joints in any 2 of 3 consecutive courses are staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset at least 40 mm so that joints in any two of three consecutive courses are staggered.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.

National Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.
P/T Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.

National Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood or CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to,(a) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (b) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (c) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", or (d) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood".

National Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood cladding shall be measured at the point of least thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood shall be measured at the point of least thickness.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text:
Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected with
batten strips or sealant when the plywood joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the plywood joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.8.5.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.5M, "Hardboard, Precoated, Factory-Finished, for Exterior Cladding".

National Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Note A-9.27.9.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text:
Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with
batten strips or sealant when the joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be sealed or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be caulked or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.9.4.(1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard cladding and door or window frames.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard siding and door or window frames.

National Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to Subsection 9.23.16.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where,(a) the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or (b) the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.

National Sentence Text:
Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3.
and 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around
window frames.)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing and sealants used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating.

National Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

National Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.

National Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be,(a) copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or (b) galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals of not more than 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals not exceeding 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with Subsection 9.27.5.

National Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence (2) are permitted to be used provided there are at least 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence (2) are permitted to be used provided there are not fewer than 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.

National Article Title: Number of Coats and Total Thickness
National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least 2 base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15 mm, measured from the face of the lath or the face of the masonry where no lath is used.
P/T Article Title: 9.28.6.2. Number of Coats and Total Thickness
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least two base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15Ã‚ mm, measured from the face of the lath or face of the masonry where no lath is used.

National Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9. and part 9., in addition to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.10. and 9.11. in addition to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence 9.29.10.2.(1) shall be mixed with not less than 3 nor more than 5 parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence (1) shall be mixed with no fewer than three nor more than five parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.

National Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than a) 1.8 m above the floor in shower stalls, b) 1.2 m above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and c) 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than,(a) 1 800 mm above the floor in shower stalls, (b) 1 200 mm above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and (c) 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.

National Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSA A82.30-M1980 Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering
P/T Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSAÃ‚ A82.30-M, "Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering".

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application".

National Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature not below 10Â°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h thereafter.
P/T Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature of not below 10Ã‚Â°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h after that.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum products shall conform to ASTM C 1178/C 1178M-13 Coated Glass Mat Water-Resistant Gypsum Backing Panel or ASTM C 1396/C 1396M-14 Gypsum Board except that the flame-spread rating of gypsum board shall be determined in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of gypsum board shall be determined in accordance with CAN/ULC-S102, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies".

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be at least 12.7 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C 1002-07 Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs
P/T Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, nails shall be spaced a) not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or b) every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on ceilings, nails shall be spaced,(a) not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.8.(4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced, (a) not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the edge of the board.
P/T Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the backing is not continuous.
P/T Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the back-up is not continuous.

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".

National Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to,(a) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (b) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(2) and Articles 9.3.1.6. and 9.3.1.7., unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for "R" class concrete stated in Section 9 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.3.1.6. and 9.3.1.7., unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for "R" class concrete stated in 9 of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

National Article Title: Concrete in Contact with Sulphate Soil
National Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Article Title: 9.3.1.3. Concrete in Contact With Sulfate Soil
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulfate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6. of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregates shall,(a) consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction", and (b) be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence 9.3.1.7.(1) shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence (1) shall not exceed,(a) 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or (b) 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.

National Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C 260/C 260M-10a Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete or ASTM C 494/C 494M-13 Chemical Admixtures for Concrete as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C260 / C260M, "Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete", or ASTM C494 / C494M, "Chemical Admixtures for Concrete", as applicable.

National Sentence Text: When the air temperature is below 5Â°C, concrete shall be kept at a temperature of not less than 10Â°C or more than 25Â°C while being mixed and placed, and maintained at a temperature of not less than 10Â°C for 72 h after placing.
P/T Sentence Text: When the air temperature is below 5Ã‚Â°C , concrete shall be,(a) kept at a temperature of not less than 10Ã‚Â°C or more than 25Ã‚Â°C while being mixed and placed, and (b) maintained at a temperature of not less than 10Ã‚Â°C for 72 h after placing.

National Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence 9.3.1.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in Table 9.3.2.1. shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by NLGA 2014 Standard Grading Rules for Canadian Lumber (See Note A-9.3.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in Table 9.3.2.1. shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by the NLGA, "Standard Grading Rules for Canadian Lumber". (SeeÃ‚ AppendixÃ‚ A.)

National Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.

National Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating the manufacturer of the material, the standard to which it is produced, and that the material is of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating,(a) the manufacturer of the material, (b) the standard to which it is produced, and (c) that the material is of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141-05 Softwood Lumber
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141, "Softwood Lumber".

National Sentence Text: The thicknesses specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated herein.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated in this Part.

National Sentence Text: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the Span Tables for full size members. (See Note A-9.3.2.8.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the span tables for full size members. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur,(a) clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence (2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or (b) structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation,(a) a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and (b) all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.

National Sentence Text: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of building foundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height.
P/T Sentence Text: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where,(a) the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of building foundations, or (b) the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, "Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures", of CAN/CSA-O80.1, "Specification of Treated Wood", as follows:(a) Use Category 1, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member remains dry, (b) Use Category 2, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, (c) Use Category 3.2, where the wood member is used in, (i) exterior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, (d) Use Category 4.1, where, (i) the wood member is used in contact with the ground, (ii) the wood member is used in contact with fresh water, or (iii) the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or (e) Use Category 4.2, where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with Use Category 1 or Use Category 2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be,(a) protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and (b) separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.
P/T Sentence Text: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material required in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material, and in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.

National Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of ASTM A 653/A 653M-13 Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process or ASTM A 792/A 792M-10 Steel Sheet, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of,(a) ASTM A653 / A653M, "Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process", or (b) ASTM A792 / A792M, "Sheet Steel, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process".

National Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 [Z275] coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 (Z275) coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring. (See Sentence 9.30.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported. (See Article 9.23.15.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to,(a) ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard", (b) CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard", (c) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (d) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (e) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (f) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", or (g) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and be not less than 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall, (a) have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and (b) be not less than, (i) 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and (ii) 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.

National Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset not less than 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, or OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset at least 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.

National Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.
P/T Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no two adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than two supports.

National Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.
P/T Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with at least one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips of more than 25 mm in width shall have at least two nails per strip.

National Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence 9.30.5.1.(1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence (1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.15.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.14.3.

National Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.5.

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are of steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to Section 9.21.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) accessible for cleaning, and (c) constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall,(a) be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, (b) include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and (c) where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in a residential occupancy ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall provide protection from the weather and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall be constructed to provide protection from the weather and insects.

National Sentence Text: Screening shall be of corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Screening shall be of rust-proof material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.10.(4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 916-2013 Airflow Test Procedure
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with,(a) CAN/CSA-C260-M, "Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment", or (b) HVI 916, "Airflow Test Procedure".

National Sentence Text:
Sound ratings for fans shall be determined in accordance with
a) CAN/CSA-C260-M, “Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment,” or b) HVI Publication 915, “Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure.”
P/T Sentence Text: Sound ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with,(a) CAN/CSA-C260-M, "Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment", or (b) HVI 915, "Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure".

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113, "Fans and Ventilators".

National Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall a) be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, b) lead directly to the outdoors with no connections to other exhaust fans or ducts, and c) be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall, (a) be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, and (b) lead directly to the outdoors without connection to other exhaust fans or ducts.

National Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common air supply duct, unless specifically permitted by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel air flow to a common air supply duct unless specifically recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer, including air balancing and airflow determination, shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer including air balancing and air-flow determination shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhaust and exhaust from the building or adjacent buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhausts and exhaust from adjacent buildings.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.

National Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labeled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labelled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturersâ€™ instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in exhaust air, in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturersâ€™ instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in accordance with the manufacturerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s instructions.

National Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with accessible dampers that can be adjusted and fixed in their adjusted positions and that include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the fan.
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the exhaust fan.

Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other
automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence (5), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: A principal exhaust fan required under this Article may be controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device where the manual switch required in Sentence (2) is capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.
P/T Sentence Text: The provision of make-up air is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.

Factory-built chimneys serving solid-fuel-burning appliances, and their
installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629, “650°C Factory-Built Chimneys.” (See Note A-9.33.10.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629-M, "650Ã‚Â°C Factory-Built Chimneys". (See Appendix A.)

(See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement.

National Article Title: Design, Construction and Installation Standard for Solid-Fuel-Burning
National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365, "Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment". P/T Sentence Text:
An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at
every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.

P/T Article Title: 9.34.2.2. Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and that serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.

National Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.
P/T Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 mÃ‚Â² of floor area or fraction of it in unfinished basements.

National Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4.(1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence (1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(3), outlets required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), lighting outlets required in Sentence (1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.

National Sentence Text: Where the outlet and fixture required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch accessible to an adult of average height is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lighting outlet and fixture required in Sentence (1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch is permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.

National Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60% of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60 percent of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9. and 9. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12. and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.
P/T Article Title: 9.35.3.2. Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement
P/T Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and the garage or breezeway or carport slab.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.
P/T Article Title: 9.35.3.2. Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in part 9., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garageâ€™s floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 mÃ‚Â² floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements described in Section 9.14. where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.

National Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence 9.35.3.4.(1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence (1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.

National Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to part 9., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.

National Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with part 9., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with Subsection 9.23.6., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.

National Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction or be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in Part 9, or Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall,(a) conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, (b) be designed according to good engineering practice such as provided in the CWC, "Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction", or (c) be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in, (i) this Part, or (ii) Part 4.

National Sentence Text: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Sentence 9.4.1.1.(1) or 9.4.1.1.(1), and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Sentence 9.4.1.1.(1), the maximum specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Clause (1)(b) or (c) and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Clause (1)(a), the specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.

National Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Note A-9.4.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence 9.4.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be determined in accordance with part 9., or designed in accordance with part 4. using the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.
P/T Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be, (a) determined in accordance with Section 9.15., or (b) designed in accordance with 4.2. using, (i) the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or (ii) allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.

National Article Title: Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
National Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence 9.4.4.2.(1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60Â° to the horizontal.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.2. Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
P/T Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence (1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60Ã‚Â° to the horizontal.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce its effects on the building so that the buildingâ€™s stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce the effects on the building so that the buildingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text:
Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed a) for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or b) in accordance with Section 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects
described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.6. Walls Supporting Drained Earth (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed, (a) for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid with a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed for the pressure described in Sentence 9.4.4.6.(1) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or in accordance with part 4. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.6. Walls Supporting Drained Earth (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed, (a) for the pressure described in Clause (1)(a) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise indicated herein, dimensions of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, the areas, dimensions and heights of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces.

National Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm, where,(a) there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and (b) a second exit is provided, (i) in the hallway near the end furthest from the living area, or (ii) in each bedroom served by the hallway.

National Sentence Text:
This Section applies to a) glass in
i) interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, ii) clothes closets,
iii) site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, iv) shower or bathtub enclosures, v) glazed panels and partitions, and b) the protection of glass.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to,(a) glass in, (i) interior windows and interior doors and their sidelights, (ii) clothes closets, (iii) site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, (iv) shower or bathtub enclosures, (v) glazed panels and partitions, and (b) the protection of glass.

National Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.2-M91 Flat, Clear Sheet Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.3-M91 Flat, Clear Float Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.4-M91 Heat Absorbing Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.8-97 Insulating Glass Units CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.10-M76 Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass or ASTM E 2190-10 Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation
P/T Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to,(a) CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass," (b) CAN/CGSB-12.2-M, "Flat, Clear Sheet Glass", (c) CAN/CGSB-12.3-M, "Flat, Clear Float Glass", (d) CAN/CGSB-12.4-M, "Heat Absorbing Glass," (e) CAN/CGSB-12.8, "Insulating Glass Units", (f) CAN/CGSB-12.10-M, "Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting", (g) CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass", or (h) ASTM E2190, "Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation".

National Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, “Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe.” (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are permitted to be used only at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, "Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe". (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
