National Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit and in public areas shall be,(a) safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or (b) wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 9.6.1.4.(2) , 9.6.1.4.(3) and 9.6.1.4.(5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences (2), (3) and (5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

National Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight.
P/T Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with,(a) a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or (b) a sidelight.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings to protect persons from falling through them shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings against persons falling through the window or door opening shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to Subsection 9.9.10.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to Subsection 9.10.20.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they a) resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space (see Note A-9.7.4.2.(1)), b) resist wind loads, c) control air leakage, d) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, e) where required, resist forced entry, and f) are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they,(a) resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space, (b) resist wind loads, (c) control air leakage, (d) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, (e) where required, resist forced entry, and (f) are easily operable, unless they are fixed units.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(1) to 9.7.3.1.(4) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in part 9. or 9., and part 9., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences (1) to (4) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in, (i) Subsection 9.7.4. or 9.7.5., and (ii) Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3.(1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence (1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as,(a) vehicular access doors, (b) storm windows and doors, or (c) windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with part 5. (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 5.3.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights covered in the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, “NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights” (Harmonized Standard).
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights that are within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

National Sentence Text:
Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to  a) AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, “NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights” (Harmonized Standard) b) CSA A440S1, “Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA
101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification
for Windows, Doors, and Skylights,” c) the remainder of this Subsection, and
d) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6.
(See Note A-9.7.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to,(a) AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights", (b) CSA A440S1, "Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights", (c) this Subsection, and (d) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text:
Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades
selected in Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with the Harmonized Standard referenced in Clause 9.7.4.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected under Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

National Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series-90 Wood Flush Doors and shall have legibly indicated on them the name of the manufacturer, the standard according to which they were produced, and that they are of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior wood doors shall conform to CAN/CSA-O132.2 Series, "Wood Flush Doors" and shall have legibly indicated on them,(a) the name of the manufacturer, (b) the standard to which they were produced, and (c) that they are of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not covered in the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, “NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification forWindows, Doors, and Skylights,” shall conform a) to i) the remainder of this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and ii) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or b) to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights" shall,(a) conform to, (i) this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and (ii) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) conform to Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with Section 9.6.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text:
Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to a) swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, b) swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and c) swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage
garage to a dwelling unit.
(See Note A-9.7.5.2.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to,(a) swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, (b) swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and (c) swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTM F 476, “Security of Swinging Door Assemblies,” are not required to conform to Sentences (3) to (7). (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTMÃ‚ F476, "Security of Swinging Door Assemblies", are not required to conform to Sentences (3) to (7). (SeeÃ‚ AppendixÃ‚ A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), wood doors as described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be solid core or stile-and-rail type, be not less than 45 mm thick, and if of the stile-and-rail type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood doors described in Sentence (1) shall, (a) be solid core or stile-and-rail type, (b) be not less than 45 mm thick, and (c) if of the stile-and-rail panel type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than 5 pins, and a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or beveled cylinder housing.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), doors described in Sentence (1) shall be provided with,(a) a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than five pins, and (b) a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or bevelled cylinder housing.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence (1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(2), hinges for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) shall be fastened to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws so that at least 2 screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), hinges for doors described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened, (a) to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws such that at least two screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or (b) to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Except for storm or screen doors, doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(8).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except for storm doors or screen doors, doors described in Sentence (1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2.(1) and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in SentenceÃ‚ (1) and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Windows
National Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS â€“ North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-9.7.5.3.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.3. Resistance to Forced Entry for Windows
P/T Sentence Text: In dwelling units, windows, any part of which is located within 2 m of adjacent ground level, shall conform to the requirements for resistance to forced entry as described in Clause 5.3.5 of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFSÃ‚ - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights". (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.6.1. Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CAN/CSA-A440.4, "Window, Door, and Skylight Installation", except that,(a) shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be of treated plywood, and (b) protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.

National Sentence Text: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9. and 9. shall also apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.9. and 9.10. shall also apply.

National Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walks shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.

National Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.3.2.

National Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls not less than 200 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Cantilevered concrete steps referred to in Article 9.8.10.1. shall be anchored to concrete foundation walls at least 200Ã‚ mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.2.1.(2) and Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than 900 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width, measured between wall faces or guards, of not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of 900 mm, or 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of, (a) 900 mm, or (b) 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See A-3.4.3.4. in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least three risers shall be provided in interior flights.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least 3 risers shall be provided in interior flights.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of treads shall not exceed 1 in 50. 9.8.4.4A. Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within a House or Dwelling Unit

National Sentence Text: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The vertical height of a flight shall not exceed 3.7 m.

National Article Title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.4.(2), risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight, with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), risers shall be of uniform height in any one flight with a maximum tolerance of,(a) 5 mm between adjacent treads or landings, and (b) 10 mm between the tallest and shortest risers in a flight.

National Article Title: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
National Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have a uniform run with a maximum tolerance of 5 mm between adjacent treads, and 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular treads shall have uniform run with a maximum tolerance of, (a) 5 mm between adjacent treads, and (b) 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.

National Article Title: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
National Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight described in Sentence (1), the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high, a clear width not less than 660 mm between the handrails, risers that are not more than 240 mm high, treads that are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrails at the narrower edge, have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and turn in the same direction, and not less than 1 980 mm clear height.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall have,(a) handrails on both sides, the outer handrail being not less than 1 070 mm high, (b) a clear width not less than 660 mm between handrails, (c) risers that are not more than 240 mm high, (d) treads that, (i) are a minimum of 190 mm deep at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail, (ii) have a consistent angle and uniform dimension, and (iii) turn in the same direction, and (e) a clear height not less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence 9.8.4.7.(1) are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Spiral stairs conforming to Sentence (1) are permitted to be used as the only means of egress where they serve not more than 3 persons.

National Sentence Text: Spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.5.2.(2), ramps shall be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), ramps shall not be less than 1 100 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: The slope of ramps shall be not more than,(a) 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, (b) 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, (c) 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and (d) 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair in a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.3.(2) to 9.8.6.3.(7), landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), landings shall be,(a) at least as wide as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur, and (b) at least as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.

National Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90Â°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stair or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90Ã‚Âº, the length of the landing shall not be less than the lesser of,(a) the required width of the stair or ramp, or (b) 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The length of a landing shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent steps or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required in Sentence 9.8.6.3.(2) from the narrow edge of the landing.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: The length of a landing described in Sentence (2) shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent treads or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required by Sentence (2) from the narrow edge of the landing.

National Sentence Text: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be, (a) not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, or (b) not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width, where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths.

National Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stairway opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300 mm on either side of the doorway or stairway, except on a side abutting an end wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where a doorway or stair opens onto the side of a ramp, the landing shall extend for a distance of not less than 300Ã‚ mm on either side of the doorway or stair, except on a side abutting an end wall.

National Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to,(a) a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or (b) the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence 9.8.7.4.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence (2).

National Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Note A-9.8.7.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.8.1.(2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights of steps and ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights, ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length, where,(a) there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or (b) the adjacent surface within 1.2 m from the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

National Sentence Text: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards are not required,(a) at loading docks, (b) at floor pits in repair garages, or (c) where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other constructed surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by a guard, or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors in buildings of residential occupancy, where the finished floor on one side of the door is more than 600 mm above the floor or other surface or ground level on the other side of the door, shall be protected by, (a) a guard in accordance with this Subsection, or (b) a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the door so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to not more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: None of the loads specified in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: None of the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.

National Sentence Text: Guards for flights of steps, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards for flights, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights of steps shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a line drawn through the tread nosing served by the guard.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards for flights shall be measured vertically from the top of the guard to a straight line tangent to tread nosings served by the guard.

National Article Title: Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages
National Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in part 9., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and a guard not less than 1?070 mm above the floor level.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.8.4. Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages
P/T Sentence Text: Except for floors of garages referred to in Section 9.35., where garage floors or ramps are 600 mm or more above the adjacent ground or floor level, every opening through a garage floor and the perimeter of floors and ramps that have no exterior walls shall be provided with,(a) a continuous curb not less than 140 mm in height, and (b) a guard not less than 1 070 mm above the floor level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.8.8.5.(2) and 9.8.8.5.(3), openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Note A-9.8.8.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of,(a) a top railing, and (b) one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than an industrial occupancy shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Article 9.8.8.1. and that serves an occupancy other than industrial occupancy, shall be of a size that,(a) prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 100 mm, or (b) permits the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 200 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in guards shall be,(a) safety glass of the laminated or tempered type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or (b) wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than 2 risers and 2 treads shall be supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross section, or cantilevered from the main foundation wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior concrete stairs with more than two risers and two treads shall be,(a) supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross-section, or (b) cantilevered from the main foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence 9.8.9.2.(1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairs described in Sentence (1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with Subsection 9.8.10.

National Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.12.

National Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in part 9. as well as to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in 9.8. as well as to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the fire protection requirements provided in part 9., flame-spread ratings, fire-resistance ratings and fire-protection ratings for means of egress shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the fire protection requirements provided in Subsection 9.9.4., flame-spread ratings, fire-resistance ratings and fire-protection ratings for means of egress shall conform to Section 9.10.

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence (5) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (3), the enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (5), such enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.

National Article Title: Signs for Stairs and Ramps at Exit Level
National Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit, if the portion beyond the exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.11.4. Signs for Stairs and Ramps at Exit Level
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit where the portion below exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, corridors used by the public, underground walkways, and public corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in,(a) exits, (b) principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, (c) corridors used by the public, (d) underground walkways, and (e) public corridors.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.

National Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of at least 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of not less than 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.

National Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.
P/T Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4) shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence (4) shall be not less than 1 1x.

National Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/m2 of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/mÃ‚Â² of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence (4).

National Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".

National Sentence Text:
Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall
be one of the following used singly or in combination: a) an exterior doorway,
b) an exterior passageway, c) an exterior ramp, d) an exterior stairway, e) a fire escape, f) a horizontal exit, g) an interior passageway, h) an interior ramp, or i) an interior stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination:(a) an exterior doorway, (b) an exterior passageway, (c) an exterior ramp, (d) an exterior stairway, (e) a fire escape (as described in Subsection 3.4.7.), (f) a horizontal exit, (g) an interior passageway, (h) an interior ramp, or (i) an interior stairway.

National Sentence Text: Fire escapes shall only be used as exits on existing buildings and shall be designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 3.4.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire escapes are permitted to be used as exits on existing buildings provided they are designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 3.4.7.

National Article Title: Elevators, Slide Escapes and Windows as Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes and windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.2.3. Elevators, Slide Escapes and Windows as Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Elevators, slide escapes or windows shall not be considered as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm. (See Article 9.9.6.3. for doors, Article 9.8.2.1. for stairs, and Article 9.8.5.2. for ramps.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm. (See also Subsection 9.9.5. for obstructions in corridors.)
P/T Sentence Text: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2.1 m. (See Article 9.8.2.2. for stairs, Article 9.8.5.3. for ramps, Article 9.8.6.4. for landings and Article 9.9.6.2. for doorways.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairways, doorways and storage garages, the minimum clear height in exits and access to exits shall be 2Ã‚ 100Ã‚ mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in storage garages shall be not less than 2 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear height in exits and access to exits in a storage garage shall be not less than 2Ã‚ 000 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation common to 2 exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation common to two exits shall be smoke-tight and not be pierced by doorways, duct work, piping or any other opening that may affect the continuity of the separation.

National Sentence Text:
The requirements in Sentences (1) and (2) do not apply to an exterior exit
passageway provided the passageway has not less than 50% of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements in Sentence (1) do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has at least 50Ã‚ percent of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.

National Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where a) the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and b) the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Note A-9.9.4.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the combined area of glazing in doors and sidelights shall not exceed 0.8 mÃ‚Â².

National Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(1) need not be limited as required in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence (1) need not be limited as required in Sentence (2).

National Article Title: Openings in Exterior Walls of Exits
National Sentence Text: Either openings in exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where a) the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135° measured on the outside of the building, and b) the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Note A-9.9.4.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.4.5. Openings in Exterior Walls of Exits
P/T Sentence Text: Either openings in the exterior walls of an exit or openings in adjacent exterior walls of the building the exit serves shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block installed in accordance with Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where,(a) the exit enclosure has exterior walls that intersect the exterior walls of the building at an angle of less than 135Ã‚Â° measured on the outside of the building, and (b) the openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 2 m above the openings in the exterior walls of the exit. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within or serving an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text:
Except as permitted in Sentence (2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm
of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for visually impaired persons travelling adjacent to walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for persons with no or low vision travelling adjacent to walls.

National Sentence Text:
The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence (1) is
permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor. (See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction in Sentence (1) is permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in part 9. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.9.6. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.5.5.(3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

National Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence 9.9.5.5.(2), are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not satisfy Sentence (2), are permitted to be placed in a required means of egress from a part of a floor area in mercantile occupancies and business and personal services occupancies, provided that the part of the floor area served by the obstructed means of egress is not generally accessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to confuse the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.
P/T Sentence Text: No mirror shall be placed in or adjacent to any exit so as to cause confusion regarding the direction of exit, and no mirror or draperies shall be placed on or over exit doors.

National Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than 100 mm in exit corridors, and 50 mm for other exit facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: When fully open, doors described in Sentence (1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than,(a) 100 mm in exit corridors, and (b) 50 mm for other exit facilities.

National Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence 9.9.6.1.(1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.
P/T Sentence Text: The swing of doors described in Sentence (1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than,(a) the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and (b) 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.2.(2) and 9.9.6.2.(3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2?030 mm high at exit doors, doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at,(a) exit doors, (b) doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and (c) doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.2.(1) shall be not less than 1?980 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 1 980 mm.

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (4), the clear opening width of doorways shall
comply with Sentence (2) at a) exit doors, and b) doors that open into or are located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence (2) at,(a) exit doors, and (b) doors that open into or are located, (i) within a public corridor, or (ii) within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

National Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence (1) shall be a) not less than 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf, b) not less than 800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf having a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and c) not less than 1 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Doorways described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 800 mm wide where there is only one door leaf, (b) 800 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with only one active leaf with a latching mechanism described in Article 9.9.6.7., and (c) 1Ã‚ 210 mm wide where multiple-leaf doors are installed with two active leaves.

National Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3.(1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.
P/T Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence (1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed,(a) no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and (b) no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.4.(4) and 9.9.6.4.(5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.6.4.(5), breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (5), breakaway sliding doors, installed as required exit doors or required doors in means of egress, shall be identified as swinging doors by means of a label or decal affixed to the door.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence (1), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence (1), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Doors that open onto a corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a room or suite having an occupant load of more than 60 persons shall swing on the vertical axis in the direction of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: An exit door need not swing in the direction of exit travel where it serves,(a) a room, suite or floor area having an occupant load of not more than 60 persons, or (b) as part of a means of egress from more than one floor area and the floor areas so served have a total occupant load of not more than 60 persons.

National Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right-hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or swing in both directions.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall,(a) swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or (b) swing in both directions.

National Article Title: Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms and Contained
National Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least 2 separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.7.1. Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least two separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have a) an exterior exit doorway, b) a doorway to a public corridor, or c) a doorway to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have,(a) an exterior exit doorway, (b) a doorway to a public corridor, or (c) a doorway to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3.(1) and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Clause (1)(b) or (c) enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3.(1) and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Clause (1)(b) or (c) enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.

National Article Title: Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence (1) shall be spaced so that in the event that one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.7.4. Number and Spacing of Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required in Sentence (1) shall be spaced so that in the event one door is made inaccessible by a fire within such a room or suite, the other door will provide safe egress.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.8.1.(2) and 9.9.8.1.(3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min or, in a sprinklered building, by a fire separation which is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance may be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room or suite is separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min, or in a sprinklered building, by a fire separation that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating, the travel distance is permitted to be measured from an egress door of the room or suite to the nearest exit.

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Subclauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(d)(i) to (d)(iv), the travel distance may be determined in accordance with those Subclauses.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), the travel distance is permitted to be determined in accordance with that Clause.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 9.9.9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.

National Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least 2 exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Note A-9.9.8.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one exit is required from a floor area, at least two exits shall be independent of each other and be placed remote from each other along the path of travel between them. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor of the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.

National Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text:
Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in
Sentence (1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading.

National Sentence Text:
Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), the space above a mezzanine shall
be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentences (2) and (3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by at least two means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.

National Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), and that exceeds the limits of Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2) is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.
P/T Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and that exceeds the limits of Sentence (2), is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6.(4) or 9.9.8.6.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than, (a) 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, (b) 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered provided it does not contain a high hazard industrial occupancy, or (c) 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clause (a) or (b).

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by
a) an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or b) an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by,(a) an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or (b) an exit doorway not more than 1 500 mm above adjacent ground level.

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.

National Sentence Text: Required braced wall panels shall be clad with panel-type cladding complying with part 9. and Table 9.23.3.4., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with part 9. and Table 9.23.13.6., and fastened in accordance with Article 9.23.3.5., or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of part 9. and Table 9.23.13.6.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing is not required where the walls,(a) have an interior finish conforming to the requirements of Section 9.29., or (b) where the walls are, (i) clad with panel-type siding, (ii) diagonally sheathed with lumber, or (iii) sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, gypsum or fibreboard sheathing.

National Sentence Text: At braced wall band spacing intervals of not more than 15 m, braced wall panels shall be constructed with OSB, plywood or diagonal lumber. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5).)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), each exterior wall in each storey shall be braced with at least one diagonal brace conforming to Sentence (3).

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where bracing is required, it shall,(a) consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm wood members, (b) be applied to the studs at an angle of approximately 45Ã‚Â° to the horizontal, and (c) extend the full height of the wall on each storey.

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing described in Sentence (3) shall be nailed to each stud and wall plate by at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation â€“ Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density â€“ Application
P/T Sentence Text: Type 1 expanded polystyrene insulation as described in CAN/ULC-S701, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Boards and Pipe Covering", shall not be used as roof insulation applied above the roofing membrane.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: In unfinished basements, the protection required in Sentence (7) need not be provided for mineral fibre insulation, provided it is covered with polyethylene vapour barrier of at least 0.15 mm in thickness.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Sentence Text: The continuity of the air barrier system shall extend throughout the basement.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior air barrier is penetrated by doors, windows and other fenestration, the air barrier shall be sealed to the door frame or window frame with,(a) compatible flexible flashing material, (b) caulking, or (c) spray foam insulation.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier installed below a floor-on-ground is flexible sheet material, joints in the barrier shall be lapped not less than 300 mm. (See Note A-9.25.3.6.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where a header wrap is used as an air barrier, it shall be sealed or lapped to the wall air barrier above and below in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Sentence Text: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-A and 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturerâ€™s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A solar collector system is permitted to be installed above roofing materials conforming to Sentence 9.26.2.1.(1).

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
P/T Sentence Text: Where termites are known to exist, exterior wood columns, such as porch supports, shall be,(a) pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to such termites, in accordance with Article 9.3.2.9., or (b) supported on non-cellulosic material extending not less than 150 mm above the finished ground and shall be located not less than 50 mm from the exterior wall of an adjacent building.

National Sentence Text: Where water permeable finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls and laundry areas is supported by a subfloor of a type that would be damaged by water, such flooring shall be installed over a membrane with a water permeance not exceeding 18 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M, “Water Vapor  Transmission of Materials.” (See Note A-9.30.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls, laundry and general storage areas shall consist of resilient flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings, concrete, terrazzo, ceramic tile, mastic or other types of flooring providing similar degrees of water resistance. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
National Sentence Text:
